body_html:
@jart I agree, it shouldn't. The documentation of get_path_to_datafile says:

The path is relative to tensorflow/

but it's not. Instead, it is relative to the file calling this method.
If it were to do what it says it does, I would leave it as is, but unfortunately, it doesn't.
body_text:
@jart I agree, it shouldn't. The documentation of get_path_to_datafile says:

The path is relative to tensorflow/

but it's not. Instead, it is relative to the file calling this method.
If it were to do what it says it does, I would leave it as is, but unfortunately, it doesn't.
body:
@jart I agree, it shouldn't. The documentation of `get_path_to_datafile` says:
> The path is relative to `tensorflow/`

but it's not. Instead, it is relative to the file calling this method.
If it were to do what it says it does, I would leave it as is, but unfortunately, it doesn't.
